result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 14CF-81 and 14CF-82 - Both Cases Called @ 11:38 AM: Defendant Aaron Michael Erdmann in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Finds probable cause exists for the charges in Ct Nos 1 and 2.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty. Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 14CF-81  Plea Ct 1:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  2014CF000082 DRI.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  14CF-81 - S/W - 3 yrs probation.  Concurrent to any existing period of supervision or sentence Def is now serving.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended; Ab Sobriety; Bar Prohibition:  No Poss/Ingest any impairing substance unless prescribed by physician; Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge.  Appeal Rights Given.  Def to advise PO in Green Lake as soon as possible of today's conviction here in Waushara.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John B. Selsing in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by counsel regarding status of defendant. Requests status. Court states warrants to remain outstanding.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.
John Selsing
Plea hearing on February 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Petition and Order to Withdraw as Counsel  - Atty Jeffrey T. Haase

records.addlTxt: 14CF-81 and 14CF-82 - Both Cases Called @ 10:30 AM: Defendant Aaron Michael Erdmann in court with attorney Jeffrey T Haase.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  14CF-81:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  14CF-82:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits for pre-lim hrg.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 10:05 am.

BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2014CF000081 AND 2014CF000082.    Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.    Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2014 at 10:30 am.

ALSO INCLUDES CASE NO. 14CF82.   Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.

14CF81 & 14CF82 Cases called @ 1:30 p.m. Defendant Aaron Michael Erdmann in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan D Keberlein.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $2000 Cash Bond. Atty Keberlein requesting signature bond. Court orders $2000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 10:30 am.
